paragraphs.zh-tw: 好的在中央公園優閒地走著今天大家全走了出來雛菊和山茱萸也全綻放了開來多麼美好的一天啊人們野餐 溜冰 玩著飛盤不論是與死黨或是愛人一塊兒 還是獨自享受著日光浴的大夥們全沐浴在一月的曼哈頓之中掌聲我帶了冰茶出來你的防蚊液有帶出門嗎?蒼蠅大的跟你的頭一樣你看見了棕梠樹旁那頭餵得飽飽 快樂得不得了的鱷魚嗎?大夥們全沐浴在一月的曼哈頓之中(吹口哨~)大家一起來!(吹口哨~)我的牧師告訴我你別擔心科學家都搞錯了誰還在意現在是不是冬天?所以我穿上了我的露背裝我穿上了我的露背裝大夥們全沐浴在一月的曼哈頓之中Chris Anderson:吉兒.莎貝爾!
paragraphs.en: Okay. ♫ Strolling along in Central Park ♫ ♫ Everyone's out today ♫ ♫ The daisies and dogwoods are all in bloom ♫ ♫ Oh, what a glorious day ♫ ♫ For picnics and Frisbees and roller skaters, ♫ ♫ Friends and lovers and lonely sunbathers ♫ ♫ Everyone's out in merry Manhattan in January ♫ ♫ I brought the iced tea; ♫ ♫ Did you bring the bug spray? ♫ ♫ The flies are the size of your head ♫ ♫ Next to the palm tree, ♫ ♫ Did you see the 'gators ♫ ♫ Looking happy and well fed? ♫ ♫ Everyone's out in merry Manhattan in January ♫ (Whistling) Everyone! (Whistling) ♫ My preacher said, ♫ ♫ Don't you worry ♫ ♫ The scientists have it all wrong ♫ ♫ And so, who cares it's winter here? ♫ ♫ And I have my halter-top on ♫ ♫ I have my halter-top on ♫ ♫ Everyone's out in merry Manhattan in January. ♫ Chris Anderson: Jill Sobule!

title: Jill Sobule Sings To Al Gore
